properties.description: Newport (Casnewydd) is a city in south east Wales, on the River Usk. 19 km northeast of Cardiff, it is the third largest city in Wales, and forms part of the Cardiff-Newport metropolitan area with a population of 1,097,000.
properties.name: Newport
St Asaph
properties.note: St Asaph was granted city status in 2012.

properties.fixme: This is the wrong place for the village Llanlwchaiarn (one L) but the right place for the community Llanllwchaiarn (two Ls).  Aparf trom a Wikipedia stub, I can't find any evidence that the village exists anyway.
properties.name: Llanlwchaiarn
Cynghordy
properties.note: Although NPE claims this is Llanfair-ar-y-bryn, and Cynghordy is to the NE, the signs on the ground definitely state Cynghordy is here!

Kinmel Bay
properties.note: English name is a corruption of the original Welsh name 'Cilmael'. From Mael's Enclave - Maelgwn was a Welsh prince.

properties.name: St. George
properties.note: The original name was Cegidog, meaning 'abounding in hemlock'. It could also have meant the place of green woodpeckers (cegid).
